alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:17AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Windham County through 445 AM EDT... At 417 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Putney, or near Brattleboro, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brattleboro, Bellows Falls, Townshend, Putney, Westminster, Brookline, North Westminster, East Dummerston, East Putney, Westminster West, East Putney Station, Hadley Field, Dummerston Center, Putney Station, Naulahka, Harmonyville and Westminster Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
